list_definition.definition: an unmarried woman attending the bride at a wedding

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The bridesmaids were wearing matching turquoise dresses.

list_ex_of_english: The activities of the principal bridesmaid may be as many or as varied as she allows the bride to impose upon her.
Her collections now include ready-to-wear, evening gowns, bridal, bridesmaids, linens, tableware, fine paper, and home fragrances.
Traditionally, bridesmaids were chosen from unwed young women of marriageable age.
He found her bridesmaids who were now elderly women.
The bridesmaids certainly did not go in munition dresses, but wore ivory satin dresses, the skirts of which were covered with gold embroidered lace, with bunches of roses attached.
A bridesmaid is typically a young woman, and often a close friend or sister.
The chief bridesmaid may be called a maid of honor or matron of honor.
We should not pretend that marriage is just a pretty ceremony, with the lady in a delightful dress, little tots carrying flowers, bridesmaids, and so on.
